lives_with: Time Split Evenly between Both Parents

other_classroom_type: She was put into a split grade classroom; ie. 3rd & 4th grade classroom.

struggle_reading_explanation: Reading fluency is okay, he struggles with comprehension/recall

speech_delay_explanation: Articulation issues with r, s, th, ch.

learning_preference_other: loves to do a lot of reading on his own also

struggle_reading_explanation: He is disinterested and often stutters whole reading aloud.
Has had a hard time pronouncing some letters and sounds
reading_disability_diagnosis: Is about average for her age in reading however she really doesn't enjoy it too much and always has to be pushed to sit and read a book.

struggle_reading_explanation: She has trouble spelling and sounding out words.
It was hard for him to sound out the words.
Has always read below grade level and this year she began an intervention at school with the reading specialist.

he doesn't struggle now.  In 2nd grade he thought he was slow. He went to see a tutor, and now he is a good reader.  He focused a lot on the spelling of words, and couldn't accept the many different English spellings rather than just memorizin
reading_disability_diagnosis: I can't remember a diagnosis, but he worked with a tutor
other_classroom_type: gifted school.  IQ test for entry
learning_preference_other: He prefers learning as hands on as possible

struggle_reading_explanation: Actually he reads at a very high level due to listening to advanced chapter books when he was younger.

learning_preference_other: Hands on, being able to touch, see, feel what is being explained

struggle_reading_explanation: He has had some slight issues during 1st and 2nd grade that were addressed by his being pulled out by the school reading specialist.

learning_preference_other: I am not sure but I think she likes to talk to other children all the time and work in groups so she can talk
